title: Snap Files Lawsuit After Yearslong Effort to Trademark ‘Spectacles’
sub_head: Social-media company sues patent office over trademark rejection for Snapchat’s wearable smart glasses
body:
Snap Inc., the parent company of the social-media app Snapchat, has sued the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office over its rejection to trademark the word “spectacles” for the company’s wearable smart glasses.
The complaint comes after a November opinion by the Trademark Trial and Appeal Board of the USPTO said that the word “spectacles” is generic, and that Snap “has not acquired distinctiveness” to qualify for a trademark of the word.
